pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:4.1: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:5.1: 11. The training rule on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:6.2: At that time a male relative of a nun who was a student of Bhaddā Kāpilānī went from his village to Sāvatthī on some business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:6.3: Then that nun stood and talked alone with that man in the dark of the night without light.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:7.3: “How can a nun stand and talk alone with a man in the dark of the night without light?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:7.7: How can a nun stand and talk alone with a man in the dark of the night without light?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:8.1: ‘If, in the dark of the night without light, a nun stands or talks alone with a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:10.1: In the dark of the night:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:11.2: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:12.4: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:13.2: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:14.2: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:15.1: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:15.2: If she stands or talks with a spirit, a ghost, a eunuch, or an animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:16.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc11:17.1: The first training rule is finished.
